DOC.brief_summary: To evaluate compare immune response safety follow two vaccination regimen transcutaneous immunization heat-labile enterotoxin E. coli ( LT ) patch placebo patch .
DOC.criteria: Healthy adult male female , 1864 year age ( inclusive ) plan start study ( first vaccination Day 0 ) Signed Informed Consent Women postmenopausal surgically sterile must negative serum/urine pregnancy test screening within 24 hour vaccination understanding ( Informed Consent process ) become pregnant employ effective form birth control duration study . Acceptable form birth control : abstinence , hormonal contraceptive ( oral , injectable , implant , patch , ring ) , doublebarrier contraceptive ( condom diaphragm , spermicide ) , IUD . Laboratory abnormality [ determine Toxicity Grading Scale ( grade 1 4 ) ] laboratory screen Abnormalities physical examination [ determine Toxicity Grading Scale ( grade 14 ) ] Known allergy component vaccine Known allergies adhesive Participated research involve investigational product within 30 day plan date first vaccination within 90 day first vaccination Donated blood blood product plasma within 30 day prior plan date first vaccination within 90 day first vaccination Ever receive investigational enterotoxigenic E. coli , LT , LT ( R192G ) NasalFlu , Berna Biotech , Ltd Ever receive cholera toxin vaccine ( e.g . Orochol™ , Dukoral™ ) History diarrhea travel develop country within last year History abdominal surgery ( exclude Csection , hysterectomy , cosmetic surgery , liposuction , appendectomy , cholecystectomy , ventral hernia repair , surgery pertain gastrointestinal problem ) history , recent acute gastrointestinal illness Positive serology HIV1 , HIV2 , HBsAg , HCV Medical history acute chronic skin disease vaccination area ( ) Active skin allergy Signs acute skin infection , sunburn skin abnormality vaccination area ( ) include fungal infection , severe acne , active contact dermatitis , history keloid formation Excessively hirsute unwilling clip hair vaccination area ( ) Visible tattoo mark ( tattoos/scars ) vaccination area ( ) would prevent appropriate dermatologic monitoring vaccination site ( ) Fever great equal 38.0°C ( 100.4°F ) time plan vaccination Women pregnant breastfeed Acute illness screen unresolved time plan vaccination Employee investigational site
